intro: Clintonia podanisia var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-flowered Clintonia, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, thriving in rich, well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in early spring, often before the leaves fully emerge, and are pollinated by insects. The species is notable for its ornamental value and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
